abstract.p: Houlihan/Lawrence Inc of Bronxville, NY, acquires family-owned Prince & Ripley Inc residential real estate brokerage in Rye, NY; terms are not disclosed (S)

block.p: The owner of residential real estate broker Prince & Ripley Inc. of Rye has sold the family business to Bronxville-based Houlihan/Lawrence Inc., in a merger of two of the county's best-known real estate concerns.

The owner of residential real estate broker Prince & Ripley Inc. of Rye has sold the family business to Bronxville-based Houlihan/Lawrence Inc., in a merger of two of the county's best-known real estate concerns.
''When you add the experience of our two companies together and you get almost 200 years, that's not bad,'' said George B. Prince Jr., the owner of Prince & Ripley.
Terms of the acquisition were not disclosed.
Houlihan/Lawrence had more than $1.7 billion in sales last year while Prince & Ripley, founded in 1915, had about $40 million in sales.
Both companies have offices in downtown Rye across the street from each other. Prince & Ripley's office is in a 100-year-old farmhouse. The merger forms a company with more than 42 sales associates.
